review: The only CPK I've been to is at this location. I went here at least 3 times already and all 3 was different experiences. The wait is never long, except one time we 'made' a reservation for 8 even though they don't take reservation, they wrote us down and made sure we got a table quicker when we came back [: The food is is always delicious. I know people love their pizzas, but I always get the salad too. The roasted vegetable salad is amazing [: We always come in big groups so each of us we get a different pizza to share. So far none have disappointed us. I mean how can you go wrong. Just pick whatever pizza you are craving for and expect it to come out delicious. The only thing I would not recommend is the pasta, and I guess its our fault cause why go to a pizza place and order pasta.

I had an amazing server and the food was delicious.  I think this restaurant is a bit over priced for dough and lettuce though.  I had the "small plates" which are amazing but the portions are very tiny and you can't really share them with others, as I did with my 3 children lol.

I just don't get all the hype about CPK? What the heck am I missing.... The food is average, service nearly below average, prices above average. I gave this place yet another try with a co-worker during lunch time and regretted it as soon as I was sat outside on a cold over casted afternoon and the dang heat lamps weren't on!!! We would've waited but the hostess gave us an estimated wait time of 20 minutes and the place wasn't even at full capacity... Excuse me? Eventually, they turned on the heat lamps. We split the Works Pizza and an order of some sort of Bacon Avacado Egg Rolls; both were just average with no pop or bang. Even the sauces that were served with the egg rolls fell flat. There were leftovers and I'm usually a pizza garbage can so that alone says something. Will I come back, yes... but not on my dime!

I remember going to CPK years ago (in NY) and enjoying it.  But I must say I was really disappointed.  We ordered a Roasted Artichoke & Spinach Pizza, but it was just ok.  Maybe I'm just comparing it to Picazzo's AMAZING Puttanesca, but this was a fail.   It wasn't nasty, it just wasn't all that...  And we were starving so it should have been delicious.
#1 KUNG PAO SPAGHETTI  #2 tequila fettuccine THINGS TO ORDER AT CPK!

The last two times I've been to CPK (two different locations) I split the BBQ Hawaiian pizza (with no onion, of course) with whoever I was with, and both times it was super delicious.  The more recent time, I had a Mango Mojito which was dangerously good.  The service is average, nothing to note either way.  This is one of those restaurants you can pretty well expect what you're going to get; it doesn't change my life, but it's satisfying and yummy!
Edible but certainly not good.  Do people who eat their pizza have no clue what great pizza is?

I'm very disappointed in my latest CPK trip. I had the asparagus and arugula salad, pesto cream penne with chicken, and a diet pepsi. This came to $22.13, but my card was charged for $31.42. Okay these things happen. The manager said he adjusted the charge but it's not showing adjusted today. The pasta was lacking in flavor and the $3 upcharge for what looked like less than an ounce of chicken was absolutely not worth it. The salad was good, the service was prompt, but the value and quality of the food? Huge letdown.

I ate here with my sis n her hubby bubba, it was good, i have not ate at one of these places for a long time, i skipped over pizza section of the menu and had the jambalaya, not sure how to spell it, but it was good, could of been spicier, i prefer mine with rice instead of pasta, either way it was yummy to scarf down like i hadnt eaten for a week, also had some appetizer items, asparagus n arugula salad, light n yum, n some guac n chips, also fresh and tasty and some egg rolls of some sort also on the app menu, they were too effin good.

I used to come here on a regular basis and I was very disappointed when they removed the focaccia bread from their appetizer menu.  I still come here on occasion and noticed they added a Mediterranean Focaccio under small plates, so that makes up for the removal of the appetizer version. I really enjoy the garlic cream fettuccine. And the atmosphere is always very nice. The servers are always so nice and attentive.
Avocado egg rolls WIN! Pizza is ok.

Planned an Unhappy Valentine's Day for my single friends and I this past weekend, we got together for lunch and a movie, we all picked Tempe Market Place as the central meeting place for us, and the restaurant of choice was California Pizza Kitchen, and I haven't been to CPK in well over 8 years, so I thought this was a perfect choice!  We arrived and were seated pretty fast, it was around 12:30ish on a Saturday afternoon. Our server was Faith, and she was good at making sure our table was taken care of! Now about 8 years ago I found my favorite pizza, the BBQ Chicken Pizza, it changed the way I thought of pizza, no longer did I think that pizza had to have a tomato base sauce, and to this day, I still love my bbq chicken pizza to be bbq sauce, cheese, chicken, red onions & cilantro, but I noticed on the menu right under the original bbq chicken, they had an Hawaiian BBQ Chicken it's just like the original, but with fresh pineapples added to it. OMG I love the combo of chicken and pineapples, so that's what I ordered, and let me tell you, it was perfectly delicious!   I also saw they had a small dish that was White Corn Guacamole, that had sweet white corn, diced avocado, black beans, jicama, bell peppers, cilantro & serrano peppers with white & blue corn tortilla chips. Omg this small dish was perfect to share and tasted so dang good, I think I am going to have to try to make it at home. I'll try not to let 8 years slip by before I come back to CPK next time.

Good visit! Friendly staff and consistently good pizza. Very clean restaurant--even the bathroom was spotless which was nice. Our server forgot about us after she dropped off our pizzas but it was still a nice visit. Try the beet and goat cheese salad. This one was pretty yum! And the California Veggie pizza ROCKED!

Why do people go here and spend money? This place is overpriced and the food is awful. Plain awful. On my visit, there was 2 people other than our party in the restaurant and it took about 3 minutes to be seated and about 25 minutes to receive our food.  It was absurd.  The food came out lukewarm, at best. The food was bland and super salty and just...gross. I wouldn't ever go here again. just awful.

Stopped in here on a Wednesday night around 7 and the patio was full, but had no problem being seated in the restaurant. The service is very good, and the food is good...but oh so pricey for pizza and salads. They have a pretty good wine selection, but again, pretty pricey for basically a pizza place. I think the location helps bring in the diners (Tempe Marketplace) but there are other good pizza joints in town!

After a very long hot day at the art and wine festival on Mill Avenue, the GF and I decided to try a new joint (built up a pretty good appetite). Once again yelp came to the rescue. After reading many reviews about this place I was very hesitant to dine here. Seeing that we were already at the location and didn't feel like going anywhere else, we decided to get our food fix here. (Boy did I pay for that decision!). The restaurant itself is awesome, had the right lighting, the background music was loud enough to hear but low enough to hear each other talk, and it's an open bar.  After being seated, we were greeted by a very rude waitress (Britni) who took our drink order. Five or so minutes later she came back with our waters and took our order. We ordered the California club pizza and also a peach tea. Fifteen minutes rolls by and no sign of our waitress, our glasses of water were empty, haven't got the peach tea yet (starting to get annoyed). The food runner brought out our "eye candy" pizza, Man - O - Man it looked delicious. Keep in mind we still haven't got the peach tea yet, with our waitress nowhere to be found I waved down another waitress, who kindly stopped and asked if we needed anything.  Ask her if she could get us a side of ranch and our peach tea we ordered 20 or so minutes ago. She apologized and said she'll be right out with it. Soon after she had left "OUR" waitress (Britni) shows up and ask if we needed anything. In my mind I was thinking (OMG are you for reals! Where the hell have you been!). Asked her about our peach tea and asked her for a refill on my water.  She reply's back "Oh, I totally forgot about the peach tea".  No apology what so ever. The peach tea FINALLY came out after we were done with our pizza.To top it off she charged us for the troubled peach tea. Aside from the horrible waitress the pizza was awesome and full of flavor.  P.S. If you hate your job that much, please do us all a favor and quit. Go find something else to do with your life.

Very delicious pizza, extremely friendly service. I ordered the Carnitas Habanero Pizza and every bite was delicious. Our server, Logan,  was very friendly and helpful - he helped make our experience awesome. I will definitely be back here.

I went to this place with some co-workers during Wednesday lunch hour.  I ordered the Thai Chicken on whole wheat regular crust.   The ingredients, sliced carrots and bean sprouts, while fresh kept falling off because it was just sprinkled on the top.  Overall, I finished it, but something about the sweet paste didnn't really match what you'd expect on a pizza.  I am just used to having salty pizzas. The waitress was not attentive and did not refill my iced tea.  Not until we were leaving did she offer to fill it with water when I was just chewing the ice because I was just so thirsty.

I was checking in here and noticed the low rating they seemed to be getting and said to my husband 3 stars are they joking?  Have they tasted this food?  They cant be serious I mean have you had the BBQ chicken salad?  Have you tried the habenero pizza?   Those two items just keep us coming back but heres where things start to change and stars start to disappear.  Since Summer hit we can no longer sit outside and enjoy the patio its just too hot so we are forced inside.  The music is so incredibly loud and not just on one visit but the last 5 or 6 visits for that awesome salad we almost wanted to shoot ourselves in the head.   You couldnt have a decent conversation.  We couldnt hear each other.  We asked them to turn it down they did slightly then asked if it was ok and I said honestly no its still not ok its horrible.  They didnt turn it down any more like they should of but thankfully another song came on that wasnt as blaring.  Next few visits we noticed the music is off the charts insanely loud but we didnt want to draw more attention to ourselves we figured lets just get our salad and get the heck outta here.   The next thing that really starts to bother me is their cumbersome approach to a frequent diners card.  You sign up for the pizza dough ap and then they are supposed to load your points sometimes they load them and other times you dont get that lucky.  You have to be a pain in the butt asking about your points if they got it right etc. just not fun and tends to be embarrassing.   They have a new promo get double points til end of July or something but we never get double so they go ask management and management pushes it off on call corporate there is a number on front of pizza dough but there is only a number for them and when you call they blow you off again.   They probably would have retained that 4 star rating I initially gave if they only turn down the music and train all their employees on how pizza dough works oh and the curbside service sucks too wow do they not do a very good job of communicating.  Last two calls went horribly wrong I felt like I was on Candid Camera and these people needed me to help them do their job it was like an Abbot and Costello movie.   I call and say oh I didnt know you delivered it curbside the response is oh yes we do so I check to see if my salad is ready and she says when you pick it up and I say didnt you say you had curbside?  She says oh you want curbside?  (Its 120 degrees outside)  Yes I would like curbside.  She seemed flustered (had her on speaker) husband says screw this I will go in and pick it up.  I have called in orders twice and the communication was so bad both times we HAD to go in and pick it up rather than have them make good on their curbside service.  I guess that was maybe a very interesting way that they have come up with to get out of the 120 degree weather.  It worked!

Got the BBQ chicken salad, spinach dip, and the works pizza with my boyfriend. Everything tasted amazing! The only downfall was that we asked for the pizza on thin crust and they gave us original crust. It tasted delicious so I can't complain. The staff is hit or miss... But the guy manager is super nice and very helpful! Will definitely be coming back.

Did pick up today for CPK! Used my dough rewards, had a problem, but the manager and waitress were AWESOME in getting the problem solved!! Took the pizza, salad and spinach dip home, I ordered my pizza to be thin crust, and sadly it was not correct! It all still tasted great, and I will return again!

Very slow service on a Saturday afternoon with only 1/2 the restaurant full. Two of us ordered our pizzas before another friend came. The third person came at least 15min after we ordered and had to wait for our waiter to put his order in.  After about 30min from our initial order, the manager came over and said our order was "getting sorted out"--which was the first we'd heard of an issue. Our pizzas finally all came out together, still with no apology or even acknowledgement from our waiter that there had been some kind of issue. We left Tempe Marketplace after finishing and while at another store, I realized that I didn't have my Visa from CPK. I realized that the waiter never gave it back. So I had to take our entire party back to Tempe Marketplace, park, and walk back on a 110 degree day.  When I got there, I told the woman at the front desk that the waiter hadn't returned my card. She told me to get out my ID and someone would be with me. Then she turned and did a walk through the restaurant, filling water, collecting plates, etc without telling anyone that we were waiting. Eventually, the manager came out and just handed back my card, with no apology for the waiter keeping the card to begin with.  I should have known better than to go to a chain restaurant and I have been reminded again why I don't. Don't waste your time with terrible service.

I had the Mongolian spiced Chopped Salad... It was the best salad I have ever had. Beware that the place is small and if you have a large group eating you will wait a long time to sit down (we waited an hour). I would for sure go back to this location. Our server was great as well.

Four things to know about California Pizza Kitchen: 1.  The food is delicious.  I used to call this place "California Pizza Sh*ttin" around the year 1999 when I tried the food back then.  I didn't like the taste 14 years ago, but I think their grub is pretty awesome now.  Tasty margherita pizza.  My wife, who had never been to a CPK before, was also very impressed not only with her pizza but also her salad.  My daughter really enjoyed her pasta. 2.  The service is fantastic.  Our waitress was very friendly, helpful, and present--and that's exactly what we needed along with great food at the end of a stressful day. 3.  It ain't cheap.  You don't go here for a bargain.  It won't break your bank, but this is upscale pizza, and a deluxe meal for your family of three could approach $70. 4.  It's LOUD.  Between the music, and people shouting to be heard over the music, this place is updecible and well as upscale.  It's like a warzone soundwise.  Be warned. Great dinner.  The coupon and gift card we had helped a lot with the bill.  Yes, definitely recommended.

The salads are better than the pizza which is odd. For a place called a pizza kitchen you can do a lot better for pizza all of the valley. Now the salads are a different story. The portions are huge and the ingredients are well selected. I go for the Waldorf Salad. They seem to be pushing alcohol more lately which is fine but after two suggestive sales of booze at 11am on a Monday, it turned me off a bit.

I've had a gift certificate burning a whole in my wallet for far too long.  Finally, the chance to use it!  Leah was our server and she was fantastic!  I started off with a glass of Colby Red Blend, while enjoying my glass I goggled the story behind the wine, it was created by a father whose son had undergone open heart surgery twice in order to raise money for The American Heart Association. Great wine with a great back story!  We split a salad and a pizza.  After drastically modifying the Waldorf Salad with the cheese and dressing on the side we quickly realized a whole salad is way too big for just the two of us (and we like to eat) with a Wild Mushroom Pizza. The salad and pizza were fantastic!  We will definitely be back!

I love this CPK. Their servers are always amazingly friendly, knowledgeable about menu options, and usually pretty funny. Their menu is extensive... something for everyone. My favorite is the Moroccan Spiced Chicken Salad and all of their pizzas are pretty good. Their seasonal soups are always fantastic too.

I am usually not one to complain about waits and time... But this particular visit was very slow The hostess was so helpful and nice  She noticed that we needed beverages so she just came and took care of us  The CPK itself is busy but not swamped I am writing this as a continue to wait for my food I'm also out of coke at the moment  We just noticed that we weren't offered bread or anything  There are so many servers just walking around but I don't see any of them carrying food or drinks... I'm about to order a drink... Because the bartender seems to be ON IT...  Foods here But we need silverware  Justine has come to our rescue, she isn't our server but she somehow managed to take care of us  Finished the meal, was good  Just waiting to get out of here now Stay tuned...

Good food, but very expensive.  They don't take reservations, but they do accept what they are calling, "call ahead".  That sounds a lot like the "reservation".  Weird.  Overall services were always good every time I go there.  Make sure you sign-up for their program for free food throughout your visits.

Went for a girls night out. We all got different pizzas and shared. They were delicious. The service was great. We had the Margherita pizza The Works and the California Club. They were all good. The thin crust as well as the regular crust was very good. Good crust can make or break a pizza for me. Our favorite was the California Club. Also had the Salted Caramel Pudding.  Delish.

Located at the Tempe Marketplace, this is one of my favorites. I have been going there for a few years now, for a total of may be 20 times. Even though they have tons of good stuffs, I could never get tired of the Kung Pao Spaghetti (I always have it with shrimp).  It's like the up-graded version of the chinese-restaurant kung pao, over spaghetti instead of over rice...

I really like the strawberry lemonade here!  And our server was very friendly, although not that attentive.  The food left a lot to be desired.  I ordered the Cajun jambalaya fettucini that came with shrimp, crawfish (I think? there were tiny bits of something white that might have been crawfish... and I mean TINY pieces), and sausage.  It would've tasted better if it had not been absolutely overloaded with Cajun seasoning.  I know the dish has "Cajun" in the title, but that doesn't mean that every square inch has to have a teaspoon of Cajun seasoning sprinkled on it!  Overall it made the dish way too salty and one note.  I didn't get the creamy, buttery, fettucini sauce I was hoping for. My dining companion got the Chicken Tequila Fettucini.  I tried a bite and it was decent, though I didn't taste tequila - just lemon.  Plus the entrée wasn't enough food for him and he was still hungry afterwards.  For $14 you'd think they'd give you a bit more food.... especially since this isn't super high quality food...
Same like any other CPK you can find. Great service when I came here in November.

Was rather shocked.  I ordered the Thai Chicken Pizza.  There was literally one piece of the precooked Tyson packed ready to eat chicken pieces, per slice!  Though I ordered light on cheese, to avoid excessive cheese as I've always done, the pizza arrived without cheese.  The toppings, green onions, been sprouts and carrots were sprinkled on the top, to cover the lack of chicken, cilantro and lack of peanut sauce.  We had to ask for additional sauce, just to have a remote taste of other Thai chicken pizza from other CPKS.  My husband ordered the tortilla soup.  The soup spoon was deeper than the bowl!  They mentioned "topped" with tortilla strips.. which was about literally 7 pieces of tortilla.. smaller than a teaspoon.  We had to ask for additional tortilla strips.  Finally, when one orders soup, there is usually bread, crackers or something to dip with.  Another aspect that didn't add up to other CPKs in AZ or CA.  We understand about cutting corners to save some money, but this was ridiculous~ Left us guessing if  we were really at a CPK or a restaurant that resembled as such

When dining with picky eaters and vegetarians, CPK always seems to be the safest place to go.  I frequent this specific CPK a few times a year due to birthdays and mini-reunions and it's always the same:  Super busy, hot food, alcohol-infused drinks, and a good time. While the place is usually packed and wait time on a Saturday night varies between 30-45mins, service is usually decent and the tables and utensils are always clean.  A short wait isn't so bad in the company of great friends.  Food is pretty standard affair.  In the end, you're really just paying for the name and a standard pizza with fresh ingredients.  My usual go-to's are the Thai Chicken hand tossed, Tostada thin crust, and the Garlic cream Fettuccine.  Yum.

I love the California Pizza Kitchen. Everytime I go there its consistently good the service is friendly. The chicken piccata is to die for, also the BBQ chicken salad is top notch. Not super expensive but delicious, treat yourself.

I've been here several times now and one thing that never changes is how slow the service is. Every time, it's taken the server a long time to come to the table in the first place. On the other hand, the servers have been very friendly. I tried the mushroom spinach flatbread and it was very bland. For an entree, I had the ravioli, which was very good. However, if I hadn't ordered the appetizer, I would have left hungry. The ravioli needs to be a bigger serving. I've had different pizzas on other visits. My favorite is still the bbq chicken. Overall the atmosphere is very comfortable, however this time I wish I had sat farther away from the bar. The music being pumped out was too loud, to the point of distortion.

They don't have enough choices on the menu, and the ones they do are over priced. I'm not a fan of paying $10+ for an ultra thin pizza with hardly any toppings. I've gotten the potato soup here before, it was good but not enough to keep me coming back. Service was not friendly.

Great staff good service, the employes are very nice and polite, the food is great, and very nice atmosphere, try the chicken millines it's the best it town!!! I love spending time at the cpk  and I also like the curb side service!!!

To be honest I wasn't too impressed with this place. I had not so high expectations because it wasn't too crowded and it looked like mediocre food, but I had heard the pizza was good. I got some avocado and chips starer and it as all right, but so expensive for how much food I received! I also got the pear pizza? can't remember the name... But it has a huge mound of salad on the top of it that wasn't even centered on the pizza. Granted it was pretty tasty, but it just looked awkward and was awkward to eat.  The worst part about the visit was that it was FREEZING in the booth we were sitting at . I know people in Arizona can go crazy with the AC, but this was just like I was caught in a wind tunnel. The service was great, but I was just so uncomfortable and wanted to get the heck out of there.

Wish I could give this place zero stars for value.... I had been given a gift card to CPK and finally used it. I would NEVER go there and pay for the way over-priced food and quality that at best is fair. I ordered 2 pizzas ( mush, pep, sausage and the Hawaiian and for he prices they are a ripoff. $30.00 for two just under 10 inch pizzas ? AGAIN RIPPOFF... Considering you could go to Papa Johns and get 3 pizzas of better quality and huge in size they should be ashamed to take your money... NEVER AGAIN and you fools that give 5 stars to this ripoff must have stock or own the company....
I do like CPK, but the stopped serving my favorite pizza, BLT. How is this possible? The have bacon & lettuce & tomatoes in this restaurant, how can they not make it?! I'm SO disappointed!!!

My husband has been on a CPK kick lately.  I think we went 4 times in just a few weeks.  And I was ready to up my rating to four stars believing they had resolved their service issues, but it was not to be. Our last visit we experienced the worst service we have ever had in a restaurant.  My husband finished his drink before our appetizers came (they were busy, so the food was slow), but the server dumped the salads off so quickly, we weren't able to ask for a refill or ask for bread.  The kitchen brought our pizza, and we never saw our server again, nor that drink refill.  Well, we did see him, numerous times, but each time, he breezed past us, refusing eye contact.  I had to flag the manager down myself to open our game token thingies.  Not easy because he was actually the server for the patio.  He was very apologetic and offered to comp our meals, but I declined.  Our meal was good, I just wanted to let him know his server was AWFUL.   So my 3-star rating remains because the food is always great, but service is just too unreliable.
Staff was friendly and I was happy to see some healthy options.  I like this place for occasions when you have a group of friends with various dietary requirements because they have a good selection.

Been here a couple times and always have had great service. The most recent time I have been here it was just for desert. I had the tiramisu which was yummy. was moist and had great flavor to it, and they even brought a bowl of whipped cream out free of charge... and the whipped cream is so good; they make it in the store. I'll be back :D
Had a small bites wedge salad. I thought that it was not going to fill me up but I was pleasantly surprised.  :) I'll be coming back later!!

For Christmas, my boyfriend and I received movie tickets and a gift card to CPK for a fun movie date night. We decided to make the plan happen one night and were excited to get out, as we hadn't been to the movies in a long time.  We decided to sit at the bar at CPK because we were watching the World Cup. The bar area is probably not the most popular spot in the whole restaurant, because it only sits like 10 patrons, but we took a chance. Our bartender was a little strange. He mentioned that he doesn't drink repeatedly and it made ordering drinks a little awkward. At one point, we ordered a lemon drop shot and we asked if he could make them. He said they had a martini and he could just pour it into two glasses. Sure. Ok. Fine. I guess that works. It turns out he made each one of us a martini in a rocks glass and charged us for two martinis. This is not what we asked for. And next time, we'll just ask for a table so the bartender who doesn't drink won't make us feel weird about ordering drinks. I believe our meal was good, I just can't get over the lemon drop shot/martini confusion. I don't mind if someone who works as a bartender doesn't drink, but they should know how to make drinks, which is their job. Part of what you're paying for when you go out is the experience and it kind of ruins it when the situation gets weird.

Came here on a Monday night with some friends. The ambience is quite nice and the we were seated quickly. We weren't really hungry so we opted for splitting a pepperoni and Hawaiian pizza. Each pizza was around $11-$12 which was a little steep but we figured they would be big. We each had 3 slices which was enough to fill us up but the pizza itself is below average. The flavor of both pizzas was abysmal and I honestly think little Caesars tastes better. I also have it two stars because I mean $11 for a tiny pizza? GO TO LITTLE CAESARS. Definitely not worth it. I would not recommend CPK when there are plenty of other good restaurants near here.

I had signed up for the Pizza Dough rewards program to get a free starter. That was nice since it was my first visit.  Both the hostess and our server were pleasant and never left us hanging so they got an extra star there. The food, however, was bland.  The mushroom pizza I ordered was served with white truffle oil, but sadly even the strong, aromatics truffle oil could not save the pizza underneath it. My brother ordered the fish tacos.  This sadly was nothing to write home about either. Our friend told us some of the other food was better.  However, my brother and I ordered items that we would normally love on other menus.  That said, we probably won't be returning to CPK.

Lots of flavor in each dish Plates are all around $15 each  I tried the carnitas, cilantro, and onion pizza it comes with a side of habanero HOT sauce!! very tasty and spicy  Shrimp seafood pasta has lots of flavor too  and spice. If your looking to have an Adult drink try the  CITRUS ADOBO MARGARITA is a great choice !!  its has chile powder in the drink Perfect !!

When we think about pizza we think about calories. But this place actually have a healthy pizza with thin breat. I visit this place with a friend of mine and he is always watching his figure and had this pizza. This place is super yummy. Great service also, they also offer some tasty wines. Cheers
I'm not big fan of Pastas, but they do the best Chicken Tequila Fettuccine that I'v ever have, and I love the Spinach Artichoke Dip.
We ate there, service was slow.  Bar service was even slower.  The server was friendly and apologetic for the slow bar service.  The food was good.
I got the tostada thin crust. It was nothing special. Ordered a beer and it came the same time as the pizza. Don't order the Mac and cheese bites, there are only 4 and craft does it better

We visited CPK with a group of 8. First off, the service was great! Our waitress kept our drinks refilled and kindly accommodated our needs. As far of the food goes, no one at our table really had anything to write home about was the butter cake on the dessert menu with ice cream. Since I am trying to watch the calories, I had the shrimp scampi zucchini. It was good...definately something different which is nice when you are dieting. I also had a side salad that my husband a and I split. The ranch dressing for my salad had an odd taste to it. The salad came with the dressing already included. The amount was just enough for me, but my husband needed more. My husband had the chicken tequila fettuccini. It had good flavor and is a good selection if you don't want pizza. Overall the food wasn't terrible, but it wasn't amazing either.

We had a good experience today at this CPK location.  Warm greeting when we arrived and promptly seated.  Our waitress was friendly and got all of our orders right (a plus in my book).  The kids butter pasta didn't seem to have any butter on it and refilling drinks was a bit slow but otherwise a nice experience.

The restaurant is hidden was hard to find in the shopping mall I spend 15 min trying to find it ... The food was good , but nothing good for kids to eat. The really bad part was the whole time we was there we had to fight off Mosquitos , we had to eat quick cause they where everywhere we could not enjoy our food!!! So if ur goin to go just make sure u have ur bug spray.

Pretty good! My boyfriend and I went here before we saw Jurassic World because I had a coupon for $10 off $40. I ordered the guacamole corn small plate (2 of them to be exact because they're awesome!) and my boyfriend ordered the baked potato soup. For dinner I got the kung pao spaghetti (my fave) and he got a cobb salad. The food was really good and the service was perfect. Our waiter was attentive and our food came out in a reasonable amount of time.  I recommend joining their rewards club because they send out coupons pretty regularly.

I'm giving it two stars only because for the most part the staff was friendly. Major issue was the food was cold when it got to the table, asked them to take it back to warm it up...about 5 mins later they bring it back and its still cold!! Had them take it back again (waited another 5 mins) and when it comes back its luke warm but not actually warm/hot like a fresh dish should be. I was with a group of people and by round two they were almost done with their meals so I just dealt with it and ate it as is...well, actually I didn't even completely eat my meal because I wasn't happy with it. I thought for sure the waitress would offer a discount for the issues but nope! Nothing.Never going back here!

CPK is one of my go-to restaurants.  Everything I've had there is excellent, my favorites are the chopped italian salad, the avocado egg rolls and the five cheese & tomato pizza.  Lunch yesterday was so good, I had the BBQ chicken salad with avocado and the Dakota smashed pea & barley soup.  The soup is really filling, I had just a cup and had to wait a couple of hours before I could eat my salad!

We ordered from here a few days ago and we're excited about everything we received!!  We had Caramelized Peach Salad, the Sicilian Pizza, and the Chicken Tequila Pasta.  The greens on the salad were fresh with quality ingredients and we were fighting over who would get to finish the pasta.

Hand tossed pepperoni pizza was outstanding as was the service. Both the server and the manager approached our table and offered Free dessert for the long wait. Perhaps I didn't notice the wait as I was enjoying nice glass of Francis Ford Coppola wine.

Ordered the launch duo ( pizza and soup) among other combinations. California viggie pizza and market soup . Great deal for around 10 bucks. Added the tiramisu afterward, didn't like it so much. Tempe marketplace location is good, huge seating plus the patio seats. Staff is good and welcoming. The two issues are that the distance between the door and the reception desk is too close and the restrooms can't serve a busy day in that restaurant.

Stopped in for dinner before heading to ASU Gammage Theatre. Why do restaurants always want to put us at table near the bathrooms or kitchen??  We ordered their Wild Mushroom pizza and Fish Tacos. The pizza was filled with mushrooms, just the way I like it, but one problem...it was COLD. On the other hand, the Fish Tacos were delicious. Could have used a bit more panko to give it that nice crunch.  Server was okay.

Not my number one pick place to get a bite, but I do appreciate the serious attitude they have towards their variety of pizza. Over the years, I feel like they've lost their novelty. Nowadays, they're more like a class act above, do I dare say, Pizza Hut.
Tastes great and the staff was very friendly and timely. Portions are small for the price.

They completely remodeled this place since my last visit 4-5 years ago.  Much nicer. The waiter was good, but it took a while for food to be served.  I was with a big group, so understandable. My wife and I shared the Pear and Gorgonzola pizza.  Our daughter had a sausage pizza.  I wasn't a huge fan of either.  The free bread you get is ok.  I wasn't blown away by food but it was a nice evening.  No one in my group had anything negative to say.

I typically love cpk and I hate to write bad reviews but solely because of THE DICK MANAGER at this location I highly advise avoiding this location all together. A real disgrace to the California pizza kitchen brand. I only say this because I am a type one diabetic and in order to maintain healthy glucose levels i need smaller portions that are controlled so that I can properly administer my insulin. I was denied the service I needed and The manner that it was delivered in was extremely and incredibly disrespectful.
It took 15 minutes to get us drinks, then order was wrong (missed an appetizer) then we were thrown the bill to our faces and asked if we were ready with the check a minute later. Wow

California Pizza Kitchen is California Pizza Kitchen. It's good. Really good. That's not why they get five stars.  The manager at this place is super nice, friendly, and makes conversation with the patrons in a way that makes you feel at home. The place is super clean and the waitstaff is generally good.  Would recommend.

We always stop  here when we're out shopping and need to get food for our 2 year old - they have great kids meals!  It's always consistent, quick, friendly service and their food is really good! I hadn't been in years prior to our recent visits and was pleasantly surprised.  They have more than pizza and their drink selection is nice! We really appreciated Brittany's professional service and great attitude on our last visit.  Definitely our go-to when shopping at Tempe Marketplace.

Me and my friend came here for our first time on a Tuesday night around 9pm. It was empty so we got sat immediately. SHAWEEEEEEET! Our servers name was Steven. He was awesome. He attended to all of our needs quickly and gave suggestions on what to get on the menu. He checked on us regularly to make sure we were okay. The food was AWESOME. All of it! We got bread with an oil basil garlic dip, the tequila pasta, tortilla soup, and the arugula and quinoa salad. All of it was GOOD! It all tasted fresh and the flavor was vibrant. I was very pleased with my visit!  I would definitely come here again. I'd like to try more :)

This was the first time I have ate at this place. We were supposed to watch the live band at the marketplace but that area very easily reaches capacity. I went in not expecting much to be honest judging from the bland decor and the fact it was very busy. It seemed like just a chain with no MAGIC. Somewhere I would fill my face with carbs and move on to the gig. There was a 40 minute wait so I opted to be served at the bar straight away. From here on my expectations were exceeded as we had extremely fast and polite service even with the restaurant being as busy as a blue arse fly. I got the thin, crispy crust pear and blue cheese pizza which made me giggle with absolute delight as though fairies entered the restaurant and sprinkled the inside of my mouth with delicious magic dust... magic dust which actually just tasted of good pizza. The crust was very well done and made a pleasent change from the carb heavy American deep pan. Then it happened... the Quesadilla starter came out with a sauce that anyone who likes sriracha NEEDS to try. It's ranch... with... wait for it.... SRIRACHA! A mystical Asian/American spell was cast on my taste buds and I promise I will forever cast sriracha on to my ranch for the time I remain a wizard. What was initially expected to be a bland and drab pizza chain experience turned in to a night of fairies, magic and sriracha in my ranch.

This is your typical Calf Pizza. Interior is larger than it looks from the exterior. We arrived after lunch so the place was slow. Our server was quick to greet us and took our order. The menu is extensive with choices and everything always looks so good. Today I went with the mushroom spinach flat bread. It arrived quickly and it was crisp but moist. Next time we visit Tempe Market Place we will return!

It's  6 45 I have a toddler. We were seated.  I had enough time for her to decide what to eat,  scribble till boredom, and Skype my mother.  Not a server in sight  in a less than half full resturant. Gave it till 7 and walked out. Unreal. Update,  was called immediately and spoke with manager. Will see if next experience is better.

Service is great, staff are friendly, came in for the Carmalized Peach Salad and found it is no longer on their menu. So disappointed. I was forced to switch to their Waldorf Salad, pretty good but not as tasty as the Carmalized Peach Salad.

My two and a half year old wanted pizza for dinner so CPK was our dinner choice. It was delicious, we got the Thai chicken tortilla spring rolls for an appetizer and that could have just been our dinner, they were SOOOO good. I couldn't stop eating them! My husband got the jambalaya which he loved, and my pepperoni sausage mushroom pizza was one of the best I've ever had. Our food arrived hot and did not disappoint. Our server Bailey was very informative, recommended specific items, checked on us regularly and tended to us wonderfully. She recommended the SanTan grapefruit shandy beer, which we took her up on that recommendation, and it was top notch  this was my first experience at a CPK and based on this one, I will return and hope each visit is as good as this one.

I only give this a one star because I'm not able to give zero.  The hostess was completely oblivious to customers standing and waiting to be seated.  Our waitress changed twice and a the manager had to bring us our food because our waitress was no where to be found. The second waitress returned after our meal was offer to ask if everything was okay. She also brought a refill to our drinks when the meal was over.  We sat there for 30 minutes while waiting for her to bring our check.  Not only was was the food average, but definitely over priced and horrible service. I may never return to any CPK again.
Fresh food and great service. Jay was our server and he was on top of it. He did a great job making us feel welcome.

By far the worst service in all of Phoenix. We waited 50 minutes for our pizza, and never did get our drinks.  Then had to wait another 25 minutes to get our check.  Honestly, the first time in my life I almost walked out without paying my bill! if I could give zero stars I would.  Crazy thing, they weren't even busy! NO WONDER!!

I go here all the time, mainly because I love the chicken picatta. My only complain about this place(and actually all the locations) it's soo dirty and dusty. I've mentioned it many times but still always the same... So today I decided to try something new...horrible. They have a seasonal garlic chicken with roasted veggies in the menu right now. It was probably the worst thing I've ever ordered. The flavor was good. But the chicken had the skin on still...and It was gross. Under cooked and chewy. So I took it off...along with the flavor. The worst part was the whole dish comes in a bowl with inches of oil in it. Food just soaking in it. Not a great way to serve anything. Hopefully they can make changes with this dish because it could be good. It was not edible.

Wow what a terrible experience!  I had a group of 14 people that i took to this CPK for dinner.  It took forever for them to take our order.  Once i placed the order i asked them if they could bring out some bread, oil and butter.  They said they were out of bread.  Its a pizza place,  how do you run out of bread?  Anyways,  they did did bring out  few pieces out. Unfortunately not enough for the whole table.  Then the manager brings out some chips and guacamole on a dish because they didn't have the bread.  There were literally 9 chips on the plate.  I joked with the manager that we would all get one chip,  and she just walked away.    Finally when we got the pizzas,  they were all cold.  We had a hard time chewing on the dough because it was so cold.  I don't think this location is able to handle groups.  Maybe a few people at a time would be ok.  The funny thing is we went late and the place was pretty empty.  They were not busy at all.  I wont be coming to this CPK again. Ill try spinatos next time

Believe it or not, this was our first time at a CPK. We ordered the sage flatbread, summer salad and BBQ Chicken Pizza. Everything was very, perfectly OK. The flatbread was probably our favorite. The salad had so much potential but you can tell the strawberries had been sitting around in liquid for awhile. They were pale and mushy. Mmmmm....and for just over $10 it was a total waste of $. We picked off the strawberries and ate a $10 romaine & feta salad with 4 balls of watermelon on it. The BBQ pizza was perfectly OK - I liked the abundance of cilantro, hubby wished it had more zip from BBQ sauce. The flatbread was killer. Crisp, chewy, savory. Oh - normally I order a club soda and receive it at no charge (it is literally just carbonated water...) but here I was charge $2+. I feel like we paid for a meal that should have been really good and received a meal that was incredibly "meh".

I just had dinner here with my honey & had a great time. We ordered The Works pizza without mushrooms. (Cause I hate them). And we tried the small plates Asparagus & Arugula salad. Everything was delicious. Service was fantastic too. We'd definitely come back. And drinks were delicious too.

When you go to Tempe Marketplace, you don't really have a lot of options to pick when it comes to food places. This place has good pizza. However, this place prides it's self on pizza. I think it's average pizza. I've had worse and I've had better. That's why I'd give this place 3 stars. Average pizza. The server was great, so, I guess I'll bump this up to 5 stars instead of the three.

Probably some of the best service I've had in a while.  Our waiter was very friendly and attentive.  Even the manager came over when she found out it was our first time there.  She was very gracious and welcoming and offered us a coupon for our next visit.  As for the food it was very good.  Great portions; I personally tend to eat a lot and one of their regular pies was just the right size for me.  I didn't leave hungry and I also wasn't over stuff.  Regarding taste, I'm not really sure if there is such a thing as California style pizza and whether or not this was it, but nevertheless, the pizza was very good.  I had the BBQ one and I would get it again.  I only wish they had a white pizza, that was kind of a letdown, but again the BBQ was very good.  We also had a slice of their key lime pie which they are famous for, which was very creamy and just the right amount of tangy.  Can't wait to try some of their other pies.

The staff was. literally out standing!   My waiter was fantastic and catered to my son's requests and made our day.  The matre'd was super with every one in the dinning room.   He made several rounds and found a table that had a problem, and immediately got it corrected and delivered the dish himself.  He then comped the desert for the table.

My family and I came in a few nights ago very late. Even though we were the only table left in the restaurant, our server was still very attentive to us. The food, as always was delicious, overall it was a great experience.

Not bad for a pizza chain! We actually order take out from this location and I have yet to come in and eat inside.  We love their Jamaican Jerk Chicken Pizza. The flavors are sweet yet spicy with plenty of flavor. My hubby loves the thin crust. This time we also ordered the Mac-n-Cheese bites as an appetizer and enjoyed the yummy gooey cheesy flavor. This place has definitely made our roster as our take out place. Thank you CPK!
for it being our first time we were treated with a free app. which was really good. the spinach dip was just like safeways but the 3 cheese pizza was pretty tasty.
Great food. Wonderful service and No mistakes where made.  every time I go I'm dined Very well and treated very respectfully
Really nice place to have dinner after shopping, great management they treated us really well thank you Paul for making our experience pleasant!!!!
California Pizza Kitchen - Tempe Marketplace doesn't disappoint. The same high quality food and service that's found at most of their locations. Would recommend to anyone looking for lunch or dinner.

1st time coming here, family brought me here. I've been skeptical of this place, therefore never trying it.  Well I was wrong,  this place is nice & clean, service was on it's game; our waiter was super patient & sweet & wait time was a bit long I don't mind waiting for my food but some may not have the patience. Nonetheless food was amazing!  I ordered the garlic cream fettuccine $12.99 With shrimp +$5 it was delicious, the plate portion was enough not to big not to small. All in all I had a wonderful experience, definitely be  recommending this joint to everyone & will definitely be coming back!!!!

Food is always great however service needs improvement. Waited for 15 minutes for someone to take my order. I was about to go to the kitchen myself to tell them what I want. Price is reasonable and chicken garlic alfredo fettuccine is well recommended.

I don't know if they thought I was a celebrity or something, but the service was so good it was almost embarrassing. I had two separate hostesses escort me to my table, free appetizers offered, drinks refilled almost instantly, and a waitress standing nearby practically waiting for me to lift my hand and order another dish. As for the food, it was about what you expect from a California pizza kitchen franchise, which may be absurd level of service all the more odd.

Came here after a movie. They have their menu posted outside the restaurant which is great if you're trying to make up your mind where you want to eat in the area. Outdoor seating is available if you want to enjoy the live music, and inside has a nice mellow ambience with TVs for entertainment. The portobello mushroom pizza was delicious as a non-meat option. Our waitress was fun and the manager was incredibly nice. She encouraged our feedback on the food and was very open to our opinions.

Excellent place!!!  My first time here I'm visiting from California. The food was fresh and tasted great! Service was perfect! You won't be disappointed. I can't say enough good things about eating here. Try it out you'll be happy you did!
They have gluten free pizza and bottomless iced tea and lemonade. Made for a relaxing Sunday afternoon out on the patio. Best of all was our server. She was delightful- excellent, friendly service.

Well, the visit didn't start out well, but It turned around. My mom and I came at lunch because of the gluten free pizza. They have a lunch duo combo with your choice of 7in pizza and a soup or salad. Of course they only have one size of gluten free pizza, 10 inch, and refused to let my mom have the lunch duo.  Also, the water had something floating in it and the appetizer plates were dirty. My mom liked the way that the waiter handled the dirty plate situation. Good point: the seasonal Sam Adams CPK has on draft right now is very tasty. Light on the palate and great for any meal. Throughout the rest of the meal went well, the pizzas were perfectly cooked, and the service was nice.

Didn't stay long enough to even eat the food . Walked in no hostess no waiter out front. Waited 5 min . Not very busy . Some workers looked at us and walked away . So now we're headed to thirsty lion . Would not recommend this spot .

Waited at the hostess stand for 10 minutes with no acknowledgement.  Once we got a table we waited 20 minutes with no acknowledgement, I had to go to the hosted stand and ask for service.  Seriously?!?

Our first time at this location n must say I was very impressed with the customer service. The manager came over n introduced herself n brought over a free appetizer very nice. My sever was Daniel n he was above and beyond great, recommend the watermelon martini must say it was delicious with this great kind of customer service I would always make time to stop in when I'm in town.

I order from them sometimes through doordash, and the order is wrong every single time. CPK blames doordash, and doordash blames CPK. Personally, I believe the restaurant should make sure to give the full and complete order to the carrier. If that's done, then it's pretty difficult for the carrier to mess it up.  After this happened a few times, I spoke with the manager, Jennifer. She said she''d send me a coupon to use for my next meal. She never sent it. You can tell this business doesn't care because they don't reply to any reviews.

Our waiter (Justin) was amazing. It was the best service ive ever had at a restaurant, seriously he deserves a raise. Our hostess was also super nice, I dont remember her name. The food was also amazing, keep it up.

Came here for my best friends birthday lunch. There was a total of 7 of us.  Our service was HORRIBLE!!!!  Everyone of us but one ordered pizza! (1 large pizza, 2 kids pizzas, and two lunch size pizzas) How long does it take to make pizza???  Before that; we were given drinks (water, lemonade, tea) it took 40 mins before someone came by and asked how we were doing. No water refills, no sugar for the tea was offered so my best friends sister had to wait that long just to enjoy her beverage!  Andrew was our server. He never came by to check on us. The kids ran out of soda, we needed water refills that took a long time to come. When the food was ordered he rushed me. He never updated us on  how long our food would be after we've been waiting for 30+ mins. After we received our food, it took even longer for him to come check on us. Water refills again, our table didn't have silverware or plates or napkins. I wanted some pepper flakes for my pizza etc.  The pizza was good. I had that with the tortilla soup for the lunch combo. The soup was undesired after first try. I didn't even touch it.  The worst part about this visit was that we even told our server it was for a birthday. After they took all of our plates we were left there aimlessly waiting for at-least another 20-30 mins. The kids were getting impatient. By the time everyone started to get up to go ask for the check, Andrew came with ice cream. Set it on the table and honestly that's what we had to wait for? This place has the worst customer service and worst birthday experience anyone could ever imagine. Never again!

Went on a Sunday evening about 7:30 with my son for a little dinner.  The restaurant was relatively quiet (customers, not noise level!)  Very noisy considering the sparse number of diners.  A five minute wait got us a table and a nice young server who was pleasant and initially attentive.  Our drinks came quickly.  We ordered an appetizer (Szechwan Chicken Dumplings) and their Sicilian regular crust Pizza.  Our server asked if we wanted our appetizer before he served the pizza and we said we did and thanked him for his suggestion.  About 15 minutes later a young lady brings our pizza and places it on the table.  When I told her we were expecting an appetizer, she offered to take the pizza back.  We were hungry and didn't care for the possibility of reheated pizza so we told her we would just keep it.  About 5 minutes later our second server returned with our appetizer which we discovered to just be tepid, probably sitting under the heat lamp for awhile.  Six small dumplings with little flavor to them.  The pizza was a bit dry, could have used more sauce and more cheese despite a fair amount of freshly grated parmesan cheese she grated directly on our pizza.  I would give it a 2.5 and the dumplings a 2 at best.  Our original server returned with our bill, my water was never refilled.  I doubt I will ever try them again.
Like usual the food was absolutely delicious. And not to mention the service from Justin was even better. He was super friendly and he was always on top of everything. He is awesome.

First time here and it won't be the last!! The service was great! Our waitress Tova was very helpful and welcoming :)  The side salad is so big and yummy! They have many dressing to choose from. Tova gave us great recommendations. The Champagne vinaigrette and cilantro peanut are delicious!  The thin crust spinach and artichoke pizza is a must! The portions were just right and I didn't leave with a gut bomb!! I recommend this place to anyone!

So we had an interesting experience. It went from average to bad to good to average. Really up and down. I think we might've had a new server. There were 3 of us and they gave us one drink menu so we were sharing it. We placed it on the center of the table and While we were looking at it, the server just came and dropped a plate of bread right in the middle of the table on the menu we were looking at. Just drops it and walks a way. We all looked up at each other. While we were waiting for our drinks (a long time) a manager brought us an appetizer welcoming us as first timers. Still waiting for drinks. Then our food came, still waiting for drinks. Finally our drinks came, then another manager came by and offered to discount our food, we were thankful. One of the drinks was an odd one, the CPK signature drink so my friend sent it back. And ordered wine instead. Our server never came back around to ask us for more drinks or how was everything. Management did. However we managed to get another round of drinks in when he came over to leave the check which he had to reprint because he never came back to see if we wanted another round. Lol. So this is why I think the server was new. Good job to management for the follow-up and TIP: your server needs to be more aware of what's going on at each table. And pay attention to the order, example: server didn't remember who ordered what drink, drops the appetizers directly in front of each one of us without notice or excusing his reach. WE had to start moving plates around pushing water glasses to the side to make room in the middle for pizza and appetizers instead of dropping them under our noses. He was very detached. But I will say management was very attentive, apologetic and turned it around to make it a positive experience. Management 5  Server 3

Food was good, pretty run of the mill. You know what your getting at a chain, but the host was the best part about my visit today. I'm sorry I didn't grab his name but from the second I walked in his was warm and friendly. Showed me the new items on the menu and made the extra effort later on to bring by a special treat since it had been so long since my last visit. Customer service is an art form!

Recommend coming later at night during the week and not during busy hours, great service tonight, food came quick and tasted great! Prefer this location over the Chandler one because their servers are respectable and professional here. Will be back again soon

I came with my 7 year old God-daughter on Saturday about 2pm.  The restaurant was slammed but they found a nice spot for us.  I really appreciated the free wi-fi so that she could play around when she got bored.  I had the GF crust with the Sicilian toppings.  The waitress was super knowledgeable about what is certified and what isn't.  Very accommodating and ensured I really understood what I ordered (Celiac wise).  The manager was very friendly when he came to check.  The Gluten Free crust was some of the best in town.  It actually had a nice crisp on it!!  My God-daughter ate the entire kids pizza!  She loved it.

Yelp Review California Pizza Kitchen 2000 E Rio Salado Pakwy Tempe, Arizona 85281 California Pizza Kitchen deserves solid 5 stars. The service I received was amazing for my Friday night with my friends. The Chicken fettucini was amazingly paired up with the amazing Raspberry Lemonade  We arrived around 6:30 pm and the restaurant was relatively packed from a Friday night. We were seated immediately. The server was really polite and very interactive with the menu. I got a Chicken Fettucini with a Raspberry lemonade for my drink. The fettucini was amazing. It was really creamy, cheesy and full of flavor. The chicken breast was perfectly cooked and full of juice. The meat was tender and full of flavor. The quality was top notched and I was not regretting getting the Chicken Fettucini. I ended my night with a Belgian Chocolate Souffle cake and let me tell you that beat all the desert I had had in my life. It was a warm chocolate cake served with Hagen Das vanilla ice cream on top, with the side of sweet whipped cream. The cake was amazing. I split it in half and there came the deliciously melted chocolate lava dripping out and it was delicious. The service was really great. Our drinks were filled up by the time we almost finished them. The server always stopped by to see if we needed anything or how good the food was. The restaurant atmosphere was amazing because the lights were dimly lit, thus giving a very relaxing atmosphere in a very crowded restaurant. The food took almost 15 mintues to get ready which is pretty reasonable for four complex dishes. They also gave us French bread served free-of-charge. The price was absolutely fair for the quality of the amazing food. My total cost was about 25 dollars, tips not included. The Chicken Fettucini cost about 13 dollars.  Overall, I was very happy with my experience with California Pizza Kitchen. The food, service, and the atmosphere were amazing and I will definitely return again. (word  count - 343) Manuth Pung, Thank you!
One employee, named Taryn, was super helpful and kind! She provided incredible customer service, despite being out of pizza and pesto cream pasta due to high demand.

Service was horrible. First of all, we walked in and they were out of pizza. How does that happen? Second of all, we walked in 15 minutes prior to close, thought they closed 30 minutes later than they did. The host went to seat us and we sat down at our table and the waitress came over and told us to leave and that it was too close to closing time and then yelled at the host in front of us and then made a different server serve us. We left because it was so awkward after that. Horrible service. Worst CPK EVER!!!!
We had an excellent meal and professional server on our visit. My club sandwich was one of the best I have had in recent memory.

Ordered online and came in to pick up food tonight! Online ordering was great, but could've used a button for sides. we came in and could tell it was busy but all the employees we dealt with were so nice and did their best to help us even though the kitchen was busy. eva went above and beyond to be friendly to us and do everything she could to give us a great togo experience!

First of all, curbside pick up is a life saver!!! For those of you that are familiar with Tempe marketplace.... parking is a nightmare. Curbside pick up is essential. The food was amazing! I got tomato bisque and an Italian chop salad. They also give you bread with every order! So yummy

water was terrible - tasted like it had bleach in it. bread was really good and was brought butter instead of oil when asked. the salad with roasted vegetables was amazingly good. pizza was pretty good and added extra toppings for no added cost. very friendly staff.

After an evening playing games at Dave and Buster's, we were hungry. This was the closest place around. We were promptly seated and we ordered our drinks and meals. I ordered their ribeye steak which was topped with a delicious herb butter. It was slightly under medium rare, but I didn't mind. It was excellent as well as the herbed potatoes that accompanied it. My wife ordered a salad that was great, and the kids finished off a Hawaiian pizza. Everyone was very satisfied. The service was excellent. We will return.

I've been to this location once before and I remember having a pretty good time with friends, and being delightfully surprised at how good the food was. This time, s/o and I decided to get takeout. The online ordering system wasn't working (and wasn't telling us why it wasn't working), so we called in the order. We got a call 7 minutes later (which we missed, unfortunately until 20 minutes later) saying that they didn't have any of s/o's dish, so he had to switch. We get to the location 15 minutes later (as told to), and went to the takeout window, where we stood around for another 15 minutes before someone in the kitchen spotted us and got a server to talk to us. While we waited, I noticed that my pasta was just sitting out on the counter. I'm not positive they have a hot holding space, but I'm assuming they do, and I was a little disappointed my food wasn't  kept hot. S/o and I ended up getting the same thing (Kung Pao-his with spaghetti, mine with fettucine) and although mine was still good, it wasn't as good as his  the Cobb salad was bombbbb though (and I loved the beets!) I did love the little touch of having the seasoned oil in a to go container to go with the bread though :)
